definition: to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Half of the vegetable freeze out in the sudden cold.
sentences.chinese: 一半的蔬菜在突如其來的寒涼中凍死了。

sentences.english: Money and credit growth unexpectedly spurted in September.
sentences.chinese: 貨幣發行及信貸增長在9月突如其來的爆發。

sentences.english: But sometimes, a moment stuns us as it happens.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有時候，一些特殊的時刻突如其來。

sentences.english: Half the fruit crop was frozen out in the sudden severe autumn.
sentences.chinese: 有一半的果樹在這突如其來的嚴寒的秋季凍死了。

sentences.english: That's what he's leaving had been like, sudden and with an awful finality.
sentences.chinese: 他的離去也是一樣，突如其來，並且無可挽回。

sentences.english: That''s what Mike''s leaving had been like, sudden and with an awful finality.
sentences.chinese: 邁克的離去也是一樣，突如其來，並且無可挽回。

sentences.english: He who waits upon fortune is never sure of dinner.
sentences.chinese: 等候財富突如其來的人三餐不繼。

sentences.english: But beyond the glow of this sudden efflorescence , a housing bubble had begun to form.
sentences.chinese: 但在突如其來繁盛的光輝之外，房市泡沫開始形成。

sentences.english: Milton suddenly and unexpectedly shatters all of our assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 彌爾頓突如其來的打破了我們所有的假設。

sentences.english: A horse may kick at any sudden, unexpected noise.
sentences.chinese: 任何突如其來的噪音都有可能使馬後踢。

sentences.english: I was over whelmed by a rush of sadness, not excitement.
sentences.chinese: 我被一陣突如其來的悲傷，不興奮淹沒了。

sentences.english: Suddenly a surprising image or epigram will light up the scene.
sentences.chinese: 一個突如其來的形象或警句突然把意境照亮。

sentences.english: Salvation presented itself in the form of a present.
sentences.chinese: 一個突如其來的禮物救贖了我嗷嗷待哺的心靈。

sentences.english: The bridge was washed out by a sudden flood.
sentences.chinese: 那座橋被一場突如其來的洪水衝坍了。

sentences.english: I love you as the thirsty duck loves a sudden shower.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你，就像渴了的小鴨愛淋着突如其來的陣雨。

sentences.english: The sudden children suddenly disturbed Song Di of quiet life.
sentences.chinese: 這突如其來的孩子一下子就攪亂了宋迪之平靜的生活。

definition: to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to come one after the other
